New Records: Weston Wilson drove in the tiebreaking run with an infield single down the third-base line, marking a key play in the game.
Key Match Events: Nick Castellanos homered and Zack Wheeler struck out nine batters over six innings as the Phillies reduced their magic number to clinch their first National League East title since 2011 to nine.
The Rays scored their two runs off Wheeler on an RBI single by Taylor Walls in the second and a solo home run by Jonathan Aranda in the sixth.
Weston Wilson’s hit came with two outs in the sixth and went all of 70 feet down the line, but it was perfectly placed and allowed Castellanos to score from third.
Pre-Game Insights: The Phillies got game-winning hits from Kody Clemens and Cal Stevenson in the first two games of the series, and Wilson kept it going.

Castellanos gave the Phillies an early lead when he hit a 1-1 slider into the first row of the left-field seats, his 20th home run and marked the sixth time in his career that Castellanos reached the 20-home run plateau in a season.
Post-Match Reflections: Castellanos was hit again in the eighth inning Wednesday, by Kevin Kelly, although this one didn’t result in the benches clearing.
Wheeler (15-6) allowed two runs and four hits over six innings to earn the win, and Carlos Estevez pitched a scoreless ninth for his 25th save.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies reduced their magic number to clinch their first National League East title since 2011 to nine.
The Rays immediately asked home plate umpire John Bacon if the ball hit Wilson on the way down the line, but Bacon said it did not.
Others: The Phillies got game-winning hits from Kody Clemens and Cal Stevenson in the first two games of the series, and Wilson kept it going.
Castellanos was hit again in the eighth inning Wednesday, by Kevin Kelly, although this one didn’t result in the benches clearing.
